sentence.idiomatic: This kid is terrible, he plays games all day long.
The boss doesn't crack a smile all day; it's as if everyone owes him 200 RMB.
Since he resigned, he spends all day eating and sleeping. He's turning into a pig.
I am really homesick. I'm itching to grow wings and fly home.
Exams are coming up soon. I wish I could turn every one day into three.
I'm so angry, I'm itching to hit him a couple good ones.

word.literal: different to people\'s face than behind their back

sentence.idiomatic: I most hate when people are two-faced--to someone's face one way, behind their back, another.
You're so two-faced. I will never trust you again!
Do you really mean to say that he's not a completely two-faced person?
If there is a problem, talk about it directly. Don't go rat on me to the boss.
Was it you who ratted me out to the teacher yesterday?
Yesterday when I criticized the child, he immediately went and ratted on me to grandmother.
Right now it's really hard to find work. A lot of employees are fully aware the boss is exploiting them, but there's nothing they can do.
Forcing people to work overtime but not giving them overtime pay--if that's not exploitation what is?
After being exploited by the company for so many years, I intend to become my own boss.
I might be having an allergic reaction--I'm itchy all over. It's really uncomfortable.
This awful weather--it suddenly started raining. I'm totally soaked.
In the middle of winter wearing so little--no wonder you are shivering from head to toe.
Our company is pretty good, they give us a 10 RMB meal subsidy every day.
Have you heard that the government is going to subsidize old-age pensions for only children?
When he was a student he had already started working part-time to subsidize the household expenses.
You're not working hard. Are you really going to let your wife and child die from hunger with you?
I've been out of work for half a year, I have no choice but to put up with cold and hunger.
As soon as he gets his salary he spends like crazy. By the end of the month he is practically dying of hunger.
On the surface, the two of them seem like close sisters, but actually behind each others' backs are critical.
Everyone calls that beautiful supervisor a shrew behind her back.
Every time we eat together he doesn't pay the bill. Everyone calls him a cheapskate behind his back.
What did Manager Wang make you do today?
Don't ask. He reemed me out. He said all my work time is spent on MSN and QQ. Isn't he the same? Otherwise how would he know I'm on it?
That brown noser, the past couple days he saw there was someone from head office here, so all day long kept trying to give us trouble.
Exactly. Ordinarily he himself never arrives on time. The past couple days he's itching to get here before the sun is even up. He really knows how to put on a show.
Two-faced. I've heard that he also often rats on his colleagues. He even goes and reports to the boss about who in the company is dating. He's really a scoundrel.
He's just a big phony. He doesn't have any other kind of ability. He relies on that to get ahead.
And he exploits us. If he doesn't make us work overtime in a week he just doesn't feel right. Plus he doesn't even subsidize our transportation and dinner expenses.
Dinner expenses are subsidized now. Five RMB. It makes me laugh my head off. Five RMB, we'd die from hunger.
Exactly. How can he do that? You tell me which employee doesn't hate him? The boss is really blind, to get this kind of person to be our manager. What kind of management abilities does he have?
Yikes, the boss likes that kind of person the best. Working the employees to death helps the company save money. He's a complete eunuch.
Hah! You feel this way too? We all call him Wang Gonggong behind his back!
Exactly! Exactly!

I'm telling you, he is really abominable. The other day he said to me ``Xiao Liu, lately you've been really busy working overtime, there's no time to have a meeting with you. Come into the office on the weekend, and we'll have a meeting." When he said that I wanted to simply twist his head off.
Did you go?
If I didn't go what would happen. The look in his eye was very clear: ``If you don't come, there's no lack of people that are willing to come."
(Sigh) How could we end up with this kind of a weirdo for a manager?
Good thing he's just our manager. Imagine being his wife or kids... they're the really unlucky ones!

word.literal: to be itching to do something
to die of cold and hunger
